title: Polygonal chain
summary: In geometry, a polygonal chain[lower-alpha 1] is a connected series of line segments. More formally, a polygonal chain P {\displaystyle P} is a curve specified by a sequence of points ( A 1 , A 2 , â€¦ , A n ) {\displaystyle (A_{1},A_{2},\dots ,A_{n})} called its vertices. The curve itself consists of the line segments connecting the consecutive vertices.
